Topic.Title: Some numbers from SC12 - either announced or known/confirmed

Message.Msg: "Appro's Beacon Intel Xeon Phi 5110P cluster scored 2,500 MFLOPS/W, almost 150 MFLOPS/W higher than the second place cluster, and over 250 MFLOPS/W higher than the AMD and Nvidia powered Titan cluster." Sounds like that 28nm Kepler-based nvidia Tesla K20X used in the Titan supercomputer is quite a gas guzzler, boys. Quite a gas guzzler. Wonder how much taxpayer money the Oak Ridge National Laboratory could save every year by switching to the much more energy efficient Intel Xeon Phi 5110P's? Hummm? And we wonder why this country is staring at a fiscal cliff....

Topic.Title: Some numbers from SC12 - either announced or known/confirmed

Message.Msg: So Best? Will that low-energy efficiency, gas guzzling 28nm nvidia Tesla K20X processor go the way of the Hummer? I thought so.

Topic.Title: Some numbers from SC12 - either announced or known/confirmed

Message.Msg: "Intel announced two general versions, the Genuine Intel Xeon Phi 5110P -- which is available in limited quantities -- and the Intel Xeon Phi 3100 series." Jeepers Best, It's no wonder the Genuine Intel Xeon Phi 5110P is only available in limited quantities. 'Cause EVERYBODY wants the #1 Best, most power-efficient HPC accelerator chip for their new supercomputer. THE Intel Xeon Phi 5110P accelerator chip. 250 Million Flops/Watt BETTER performance than the nvidia Tesla K20X part. Which sucks juice like an Elephant. Making the Intel Xeon Phi 5110P Numero Uno at the top of the Green 500 list. 'Cause, well, it simply the best.

Message.Title: Fiscal Cliff? What is the tax rate for dividend? I don't want dividend stocks!!!
Message.Msg: What is the tax rate for the dividend next year?

Topic.Title: Fiscal Cliff? What is the tax rate for dividend? I don't want dividend stocks!!!

Message.Msg: Didn't Best specificially tell Jen to make it a One Time Dividend? He sure did. Take a look. Right here on this fine board. Search for this : "Jeepers Best, Everybody else pays a dividend." "So let's say that the Institutional Investors have gathered, smoked some nice Cuban cigars, told a few yachting stories, and voted. Jen is out at CEO, and the new guy is in. And let's say the new guy decides that $3 Billion of cash is Waaaay too much to be holding for no particular reason. And he decides to distribute say, $2 Billion of it as a one-time Dividend. Here's how some of the checks would look. Pay to the Order of: $280.8 million __ FMR LLC $122.0 million __ PRICE (T.ROWE) ASSOCIATES INC $112.6 million __ VANGUARD GROUP, INC. (THE) $62.4 million __ PRIMECAP MANAGEMENT COMPANY $53.2 million __ BlackRock Institutional Trust Company, N.A. $30.2 million __ AllianceBernstein, L.P. $25.4 million __ Invesco Ltd. $22.6 million __ BlackRock Fund Advisors $323.88 __ for a holder of 1,000 shares "And when is a good time to meet?" See that part? Hummm? "...distribute say, $2 Billion of it as a one-time Dividend." Great advice from Best, right? It sure was. The best advice -- as always. And what did we get instead from Jen? A teeny-tiny Recurring dividend of $00.075 -- which will be taxed at the Higher future tax rate. So the rest of the more financially astute companies will be printing-up their Tax Efficient One Time Dividends this year, while Jen dawdles around with his Higher Taxed teeny-tiny little dividends. And they wonder why this sinker is hitting new 52-week lows every day following Jen's Tax Inefficient teeny-tiny recurring dividend. Enjoy paying your higher taxes, boys.

Topic.Title: Fiscal Cliff? What is the tax rate for dividend? I don't want dividend stocks!!!

Message.Msg: So Master? Maybe current CEO Jen doesn't care if his hapless shareholders pay Higher Taxes on the nvidia dividends in the future. Jen's already got their money.

Topic.Title: Fiscal Cliff? What is the tax rate for dividend? I don't want dividend stocks!!!

Message.Msg: I get it now. If the tax rate on dividends is going up, -- 'cause of the fiscal cliff that Washington will fall off of without higher taxes -- it is best to pay Lots of Big Dividends Right Now -- before the tax rate is increased. So why can't Jen get that simple concept? Or maybe, he just doesn't care about the hapless shareholder's tax bill.

Message.Title: If Jen doesn't get the 10-Q out next week, I'm callin' the Authorities.
Message.Msg: This is ridiculous. Just Ridiculous. Jen and his interim launched the sensationalized headlines a week ago Thursday, right?. But there is still no fact-filled 10-Q available for the investor community. None. nvidia needs to get more like Apple, you know. Apple releases their 10-Q report much faster than nvidia. Much Much Faster. Like, THE DAY AFTER THE EARNINGS ANNOUNCEMENT. It's true. And remember, Apple is a much much larger enterprise than nvidia. Much Much Larger. So they have oh so much more accounting to do. For example, Apple has 70 Times the EBITDA that little nvidia has. Yet they get their financial results to their lucky investors, well, Faster. Like, THE DAY AFTER THE EARNINGS ANNOUNCEMENT. Not a week ago last Thursday -- and we're all still waiting on it. Maybe another management issue here, right boys? OR, maybe Jen and his interim are tryin' to finagle the 10-Q numbers a bit? You know, like maybe make the Tegra/CPB look, well, not so bad? Maybe moving a bunch of tegra engineers from CPB unit to maybe the GPU unit? Thereby moving a bunch of expenses that belong in the Tegra/CPB, well, out. There's gotta be some reason Jen is so slow in getting the 10-Q released.
As we've learned from the past, ya gotta watch the reporting from these guys very very carefully.

amd going down will be a total disaster for nvda. intel buys amd for the graphics, before you know it, onboard graphic more capable +, here's the huge +, proprietary graphic bus. nvda graphics goes the same way as their chip set biz.

Thanks Best. I was totally unaware of nvidia's past history with reporting issues. Wells Notices, SEC investigations, Cease and Desist Agreements, the ex-CFO getting fined, restatement of past quarters and this and that. I'll be more watchful in the future. Thanks again, Best.

Topic.Title: Some numbers from SC12 - either announced or known/confirmed

Message.Msg: HPC, big yawn, there's no money in it. just look up the sales of Cray. Where's Wayne??

"intel buys amd for the graphics" Do you have any evidence of this ?? I will assume NOT... but you're welcome to prove me wrong... "proprietary graphic bus." INtel is going PoP... system in a package...will attempt to kill discrete GPUs...what's new though The only reason they kept PCI-E is from court settlements...but that will expire They have QPI bus now...for high-end CPU connections... and probably Xeon Phi next gen....
You keep talking about "going down" LOL Is this one of your daily "specials"? Beware of your Freudian slips, biotch whoosunw!

Tegra 4 is DOA? or, at least its not in control of its own destiny. In 2012, Nvidia dominated non-apple, non-samsung, non-amazon tablet sales. Unfortunately, the SAM for that was quite small. Nvidia thinks it can reverse smartphone absence by integrating LTE. There are 2 BIG problems with that theory: 1. NVDA does not have a popular discrete LTE modem. 2. QCOM has set the bar so high with integration that NVDA has no opportunity of winning the integration war and smartphone SOC. - S4 Pro has 3G/LTE (World Mode), 802.11ac, BT 4.0, GPS etc. all integrated on a single die. The only hope for NVDA is a misstep from QCOM, e.g. integrated LTE or, 802.11ac performance is worse than a discrete design. NVDA can under-cut QCOM pricing but the market will not reward a stock with declining margins.

Message.Title: I'm out
Message.Msg: This one is doomed. I'm dumping all I have left Monday...huge loss. Intel claims yet another victim.

Topic.Title: If Jen doesn't get the 10-Q out next week, I'm callin' the Authorities.

Message.Msg: "you are a professional basher", writes current Yahoo Member "smallstock1", Libelously. "what ties to wall st do you have? tell us!" First, as Best has posted here before , in writing, on this global venue, Neither Best, nor the People of Bestville, are professional bashers. Oh no no no. Not compensated in any way to post here. Best is just an individual investor, like you. Secondly, you ask about Best's ties to Wall Street. Answer : None. Well, okay. Best has multiple accounts with the Private Client Group at Fidelity. But they're not a Wall Street firm. They're from Cincinnati. Nice folks too. I like Fidelity. As Best has posted before on this Yahoo board (this will be the 34nd time actually); -------------------------------------------------------------------------- "The person associated with the Yahoo ID best.here -- and the other fine People of Bestville -- is NOT compensated -- directly or indirectly -- in any way to post on this or any other message board." I repeat, NOT compensated in any way. Seriously. -------------------------------------------------------------------------- Best is just another individual investor. Who shorts dog stocks -- like nvidia. Playing the downside of the Market -- as well as the upside -- enhances the return of an otherwise very long, blue-chip portfolio. You've purported a False and Serious Accusation in writing, smallstock1. And I've now denied it in writing on a global venue. 34 times now, actually. And I'm now Behesting you to Cease making your False Accusations of me being a paid basher. When I am in Fact, not a "paid basher". Oh no no no. You might want to speak with competent legal counsel before replying. Since deliberately or inadvertently making your Libelous Statements is unlawful in all 50 states. After you've been previously warned. Which you have been. In writing, on a public venue, and behested to stop.

Intel is hardly the reason for dumping NVDA. This one has 99 problems and INTC ain't one. NVDA ever increasing OpEx and declining market share in mobile App Processor - yes. 2013 OEM Trends: Apple - in house processor Samsung - in house processor and QCOM in LTE markets Nokia - QCOM RIMM - QCOM Amazon - TI Asus - NVDA and QCOM LG - QCOM You see the trends, QCOM will be big winner in 2013. NVDA will follow the TI route at some point and exit Mobile App Processor business and write-off Icera etc.

Topic.Title: If Jen doesn't get the 10-Q out next week, I'm callin' the Authorities.

Message.Msg: X We can still make our own Deletion Marks, right smallstock1?

QCOM is critically dependent upon over booked TSCM (Taiwan semi) who can't manufacture reliably at 28nm, let alone 22nm. QCOM and INTC may become buddies since INTC can reliably fab, but of course, that would mean paying royalties to ARMH which INTC is loathe to do. The only real player out there, the one that will still be standing in 5 years, is INTC.

really? that is your analysis - TSMC will not be able to overcome whatever limitations they currently have. really? INTC will be around for a long time - yes, no doubt they have superior fab BUT their balance sheet is no longer as fortress as it used to be. Remember their cash acquisition of McAfee. You can look at their declining CapEx and soon other foundries will be closing the gap. QCOM should be bought on dips and NVDA sold on spikes. I am neutral on INTC, they make a good stock for 401k's but not worthy of trading.

Topic.Title: If Jen doesn't get the 10-Q out next week, I'm callin' the Authorities.

Message.Msg: post your name and other credentials to prove it. I said you are a professional basher....you should be proud of that ....meaning you are good at what you do. You admit you do it for a living...that's a professional....I am asking what ties you have to wall st... that is a question???? Sound to me, based on your threat to me, that you could be a lawyer as well.... Look, your threat to sue me is childish.... grow up...

Well, basically you are wrong on all counts but since you were too chicken sh$t to respond to earlier messages where Nvidia didn't have any warning and is staying the course AND declaring the dividend with an extended buyback plan, your comments really carry little weight. You conveniently omit all the places where Nvidia is the first choice of flagship products and only comment on increased OpEx when it increases not when it is actually levelling or going lower. They made it clear why the OpEx was going up and that's actually the trend of the competition as well this time of year. Anyways, your doomsday scenario is out of line. You are even using failed companies use of the competitions chips to beef up your distorted observations.

I don't know what messages you are referring to but I would be happy to engage in a healthy debate. I actually like Nvidia the company, I have bought their products - Nexus 7 being the latest. I am just not in love with NVDA the stock - that's all. Ask yourself this: 1. Why did NVDA start a dividend now? IR was asked this question at UBS conf. and gave a non-answer answer. I will tell you why, they want to help stock price from falling too much. Their earlier efforts of returning value to stockholders by investing in R&D has not paid adequate dividends with stock price languishing at 52 week low. 2. NVDA has an outstanding stock repurchase program BUT has not actually exercised any buybacks this year despite 52-week low. Why? NVDA sees a tough year in 2013 and expects to buy back stock at much lower price. 3. Why a tough 2013? - Project Wayne delays (Q1 2013) - Project Grey delays (Q3 2013) NVDA will probably have moderate success in Android Tablet market but no where close to 100% growth they experienced in 2012. NVDA will not make any progress in Android Smartphone segment - see my earlier comments on failure to gain traction with discrete LTE modems to fully appreciate QCOM Snapdragon S4 competition. And obviously its not just me, look at the market reaction when on the face of it - NVDA beat numbers and declared dividend and extended stock repurchase yet NVDA the stock has sold off on increasing volume. If that is not a sure sign then I don't know what it.
"Intel claims yet another victim." How...?? INtel PC sales were down, but NVidia GPU sales were up... Tegra had a record Q... NVidia had a record Q...
NVDA went down for they guided lower for Q4...

exactly, NVDA "had" record Q's... as you probably know, market is forward looking. Nothing much to look forward to in 2013, hence the sell-off, down over 12%. I think NVDA will trade in 13 - 9 range in 2013.

"Nothing much to look forward to in 2013" Hmmm... Jensen couldn't wait to get out of Tegra questions fast enough... very vague responses... But Project Denver is gonna be announced sometime... and it's gonna have a lot of buzz... Tegra 4 will also have Kepler GPUs... will support more PC like games than QCOM or anyone else in the ARM SOC camp...great fo tablets !!!! but the lack of LTE is holding back their smartphone penetration... In 2014, NVidia will have all their own IP, from CPU cores, GPU cores, and finally LTE... QCOM and the rest will NOT... Yeah, 2014 is looking out a while... but it is what it is... so don't say this company is thru... it's like saying who will win the superbowl a few years from now...

I think we're going to be surprised pleasantly about the LTE integration. The OpEx increase is directly tied to this push. Can't know this with certainty but I'm betting something out by June 2013. Also, Tegra 4 is going to leapfrog what's out there now in GPUs and I'm thinking by February the buzz will be showing up big in the stock price.
roundhouse, hope you're right !!!!!!!!!!! maybe Jensen's responses were tied to lower Q4 outlook ??? time will tell...

"Why a tough 2013? - Project Wayne delays (Q1 2013) - Project Grey delays (Q3 2013)" really??!! getanid can't even read ON the line, what's your problem?? nvda has already come out and said: Grey tape now now, Wayne and Grey will go to market at roughly the same time. And you and getanaid are still expecting Wayne Jan or Q1 2013??? ibex, when will Wayne come out??

"getanid can't even read ON the line, what's your problem??" You act like you are informing the world of something everyone already knows... Name anyone who hasn't known for sometime Wayne will be Q1 2013...?? I heard, exactly when you, and everyone else heard about Grey...

"Name anyone who hasn't known for sometime Wayne will be Q1 2013...??" roflol, I rest my case, this guy can't even read ON the line. for the others, go read what ibex posted about the schedule for Grey and Wayne.

really now... are you saying Ibexx didn't know Wayne would be Q1 2013 ?? if that's what you think you got on me... enjoy it... I assure you, I've never had doubt about its release date... not since a year or so ago when NVidia adjusted their roadmaps...

"Grey has been moved up to Q1 2013 from Q3, per xbitlabs and softpedia articles " That seems mighty quick if they are just taping out now... "The bashing idiot came here screaming with out-of-date knowledge....no wonder she got laid off by companies. (Yes, more than once)" Hmmm...how would anyone know that ?? What we do know is she has an emotional attachment to BRCM... so I do assume she worked their before...

So Master? Another question, if I may. That would be known as a "cause and effect" relationship, right? The cause would be that nvidia's line-up of chips is getting stale and old. Because the new chips keep getting delayed and delayed and delayed. So all nvidia has to sell is yesterday's, old stale chips. The effect is that, well, the stock is hitting new 52-week lows every day. 'Cause the Market, she doesn't like old things. Oh no no no. She wants New things -- like shoes and cars and this and that.

Message.Title: On second thought - probably a dumb idea to short NVDA here
Message.Msg: OK - just so that I don't mislead anyone. It may not be a great idea to short NVDA at this price - very little to gain. There can be significant pain if the long rumored Microsoft acquisition were to happen. I think Microsoft will eventually have to react and 1-up Apple strategy. They have already entered hardware business with Surface tablet. I think they will need SOC edge sooner than later (ala Apple). So no great reason to be long NVDA stock at this point - maybe buying some 2014 Leaps would be a way to go.

Topic.Title: While nvidia dawdles, TI has captured another new market -- Wireless Charging

Message.Msg: Gentlemen, this has to be a HUGE HUGE new market. Absolutely Huge. The wireless charging of things with batteries. Billions of mobile devices, probably. Billions. Pass the cigar lighter please, J.B. Thanks. So why didn't our current man Jen take us into THAT huge emerging market? Making the IC chips for wireless charging. Hummm? The guy has hoarded over Three Billion Dollars of shareholder's cash now. THREE BILLION DOLLARS, gentlemen. Hoarded. And for what? Hummm? To PRETEND that there are no hot new emerging markets to be conquered? To wear BLINDERS to the new opportunities unfurling before us? Yes UNFURLING as we speak, gentlemen. Like TI's fantastic new wireless charging business. They've got like 100% market share of a rapidly emerging market already. WE should be investing in something like that. Wireless charging of mobile devices. THE hottest trend in mobile -- which our current man Jen missed completely. Yes, Completely. { sigh } Gentlemen, I for one believe it's high time for new, visionary leadership at the top. We've got the cash -- more cash than we could possibly ever need. But what we're LACKING today gentlemen -- is the GUTS and the VISION to put that cash to work.
